column4: FDA panel supports broader use of Medtronic heart devices
column5: Oct 8 A federal advisory panel recommended that Medtronic Inc be allowed to sell certain implantable electronic heart devices to a larger pool of patients  based on study results that showed the products reduced the risk of death and hospitalization.

column4: Mizuho's top management knew of organized crime loans
column5: TOKYO Officials at Mizuho Financial Group   Japan's second-biggest bank  admitted top management knew at least three years ago about loans to criminal groups  highlighting the entrenched position of organized crime in the Japanese business world.

column4: Reshaped Pfizer plans to fine-tune research spending
column5: CAMBRIDGE  England Nearly three years after a cost-cutting drive that stunned many in the drugs industry  Pfizer Inc's head of research Mikael Dolsten says his scientists are delivering more for less.

column4: Teva sees obstacles to copying GSK's Advair drug before 2018
column5: LONDON Teva Pharmaceuticals does not expect to see the launch of generic copies of GlaxoSmithKline's best-selling lung drug Advair that could be sold as a true substitute to U.S. patients before 2018.

column4: Gottex joins ex-Blackstone  Goldman execs to seed Asian hedge funds
column5: HONG KONG  Oct 8 Swiss fund-of-hedge-funds manager Gottex is partnering with two former executives of Blackstone Group and Goldman Sachs to back Asian hedge fund managers starved of capital since the global finance crisis.

column4: Eight banks join Markit and Thomson Reuters chat network
column5: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  JPMorgan Chase & Co and six other banks have agreed to join a new instant messaging network from Markit and Thomson Reuters Corp to connect disparate messaging systems.

column4: UPDATE 1-Toyota to face U.S. trial over vehicle acceleration

column4: Aston Martin scraps Cygnet city car after dire sales
column5: LONDON Aston Martin  has abandoned its attempt to tap into the popularity of so-called city cars after selling fewer than 150 of its "Cygnet" model  an embarrassing blow to the struggling 100-year-old British luxury sports car maker.

column5: Oct 8 KFC parent Yum Brands Inc on Tuesday warned that sales at established restaurants in its top market of China are unlikely to rebound in the fourth quarter  as it had expected  and its shares tumbled 6.5 percent in extended trading.
